textcards.caption: LEND ME YOUR HORSE
textcards.description: Non-pawn pieces protected by a knight may also move/take like a knight.
textcards.quote: "You should know better than to mount another's war-horse", I said with a smirk. ---Jessica Leake

textcards.caption: JEDI KNIGHT
textcards.description: If you only have one knight on the board, it can also move and take like a Queen.
textcards.quote: In my experience, when you think you understand the Force, you realize just how little you know. ---Ahsoka Tano

textcards.caption: PRECOCIOUS PAWNS
textcards.description: Pawns start on the third rank. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: Precocious was not the same as smart, much less the same as wise, and the perfect opposite of informed. ---Lionel Shriver

textcards.caption: CHECKERS
textcards.description: Pawns move and take like checkers.
textcards.quote: These guys are playing checkers. I'm out here playing chess. When they figure it out, it's too late. ---Max Holloway

textcards.caption: BEROLINA PAWNS
textcards.description: Pawns move diagonally and take forward.
textcards.quote: Berolina is the female personification of Berlin and the allegorical female figure symbolizing the city. ---Wikipedia

textcards.caption: BEROLINA PAWNS II
textcards.description: Pawns move diagonally. The take forward and sideways.
textcards.quote: Berolina is the female personification of Berlin and the allegorical female figure symbolizing the city. ---Wikipedia

textcards.caption: SHOGI PAWNS
textcards.description: Pawns move and take one square forward. Two Shogi Pawns may not be placed in the same file. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: If there is mate with a Pawn drop, there is a legal mate too. ---Shogi proverb

textcards.caption: FAST PAWNS
textcards.description: Pawns capture normally, but may move any number of squares forward. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: In ceremonies of the horsemen, even the pawn must hold a grudge. ---Bob Dylan

textcards.caption: BRIBE
textcards.description: On your turn you can do an action by an enemy pawn instead. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: Never underestimate the effectiveness of a straight cash bribe. ---Claud Cockburn

textcards.caption: CHINESE CHECKERS
textcards.description: Pawns take normally, but move like Chinese checkers.
textcards.quote: \tiny The Pentagon banned the army from using Chinese-made berets. In a more veiled slap at the Chinese, the Pentagon also banned any alternative form of checkers. ---Jimmy Fallon

textcards.caption: NIGHT WIZARD
textcards.description: Move/take life a giraffe [1,3], or one square diagonally [1,1].
textcards.quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of Wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger. ---J. R. R. Tolkien

textcards.caption: TALLADEGA KNIGHTS
textcards.description: Knights on your color may move/take like Rooks. Knights on your opponents colore may move/take like Bishops.
textcards.quote: If you ain't first, you're last. ---Ricky Bobby

textcards.caption: TOUCHDOWN
textcards.description: If your king is on the last rank at the end of your turn, you win.
textcards.quote: It's one of those things: I would 100 percent pancake a guy and steal his soul over scoring a touchdown. ---George Kittle

textcards.caption: SUMO KING
textcards.description: Kings may take normally or shove billiards style. Pieces that fall of the edge die.
textcards.quote: Good spirit! But you should push an opponent with more force! ---E. Honda

textcards.caption: FAR MIMIC
textcards.description: Kings act only as any friendly piece which can move to it. No castling. If pawn can move to king and king is on rank 2, can move 2 as pawn and be taken en-passant.
textcards.quote: Quote needed

textcards.caption: NEAR MIMIC
textcards.description: Kings act only as any adjacent friendly piece. No castling. If pawn can move to king and king is on rank 2, can move 2 as pawn and be taken en-passant.
textcards.quote: Quote needed

textcards.caption: ALL PASSANT
textcards.description: Any piece may capture any piece en passant.
textcards.quote: You never advance without losing something en passant, and you lose it because you're paying so much attention to the new thing. ---Ninette de Valois

textcards.caption: CAMOUFLAGE
textcards.description: You can move through pieces on squares matching your color.
textcards.quote: \tiny Camouflage is a game we all like to play, but our secrets are as surely revealed by what we want to seem to be as by what we want to conceal. ---Russell Lynes

textcards.caption: PARACHUTE
textcards.description: You may pick up friendly pieces. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: Quote needed

textcards.caption: SACRIFICE
textcards.description: You may take your own pieces. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: You can't achieve anything in life without a small amount of sacrifice. ---Shakira

textcards.caption: NEAR SWAP
textcards.description: Two adjacent friendly pieces may swap places.
textcards.quote: Quote needed

textcards.caption: KNIGHT SWAP
textcards.description: Two friendly pieces which are a standard knight move apart may swap places.
textcards.quote: Quote needed

textcards.caption: MOVE SWAP
textcards.description: Two friendly pieces may swap places if one can move to or take the other.
textcards.quote: Quote needed

textcards.caption: UNFAIR
textcards.description: Deal a card. It only applies to white or black; white decides. Repeat for black decides.
textcards.quote: I know the world isn't fair, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor? ---Bill Watterson

textcards.caption: UNFAIR
textcards.description: Deal a card. It only applies to white or black; white decides. Repeat for black decides.
textcards.quote: I know the world isn't fair, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor? ---Bill Watterson

textcards.caption: BOUNCE
textcards.description: The board continues by reflection in the outer ranks and files.
textcards.quote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom. ---George S. Patton

textcards.caption: CYLINDER
textcards.description: Pieces may move as if the right and left side of the board are adjacent to each other.
textcards.quote: Everything in nature takes its form from the sphere, the cone and the cylinder. ---Paul Cezanne

textcards.caption: PROFESSIONAL COURTESY
textcards.description: Pieces do not attack or capture a piece of the same type. Pawns are not professional.
textcards.quote: Courtesy is contagious - let's start an epidemic. ---Evan Esar

textcards.caption: INSANE CYLINDER
textcards.description: Pieces do not move/take backwards. The top and bottom of the board are considered adjacent.
textcards.quote: There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line. ---Oscar Levant

textcards.caption: MOVE THROUGH FRIENDLY PIECES
textcards.description: Friendly pieces do not block movement.
textcards.quote: True friends stab you in the front. ---Oscar Wilde

textcards.caption: COMPLICATE
textcards.description: Deal two more cards.
textcards.quote: When all else fails, complicate matters. ---Aaron Allston

textcards.caption: COMPLICATE
textcards.description: Deal two more cards.
textcards.quote: Progress is man's ability to complicate simplicity. ---Thor Heyerdahl

textcards.caption: CHAOS
textcards.description: Deal three more cards.
textcards.quote: Life is nothing without a little chaos to make it interesting. ---Amelia Atwater-Rhodes

textcards.caption: SUPREME SACRIFICE
textcards.description: You may remove any number of friendly pieces before your turn.
textcards.quote: The speed of your success is limited only by your dedication and what you're willing to sacrifice. ---Nathan W. Morris

textcards.caption: MOVE TWICE
textcards.description: Move twice, or any other action once.
textcards.quote: When someone says you can't do something, do it twice and take pictures. ---Anonymous

textcards.caption: TAKE TWICE
textcards.description: Take twice, or any other action once.
textcards.quote: As long as I breathe, I attack. ---Bernaud Hinault

textcards.caption: EXTINCTION
textcards.description: You lose if you lose all of any piece.
textcards.quote: Extinction is the rule. Survival is the exception. ---Carl Sagan

textcards.caption: CROWDSURF
textcards.description: Any non-King piece can crowdsurf.
textcards.quote: The joy of surfing is so many things combined, from the physical exertion of it to the challenge of it, to the mental side of the sport. ---Kelly Slater

textcards.caption: OOBLEK
textcards.description: Pieces must move as far as legally possible.
textcards.quote: To me, if life boils down to one thing, it's movement. To live is to keep moving. ---Jerry Seinfeld

textcards.caption: 10x10 BOARD
textcards.description: The legal playing area now surrounds the board. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: I don't have anything against walls. You know what it is? I like open spaces. ---Dion Dublin

textcards.caption: TELEPORTER
textcards.description: Identify the piece type adjacent to the King towards the center as a teleporter. Teleporters may move to any square adjacent to a pawn.
textcards.quote: If I could teleport, I'd probably still be late. --Anonymous

textcards.caption: MINOR TENET
textcards.description: Bishops move and take backwards like Knights. Knights move and take backward like Bishops.
textcards.quote: Bold I'm Fine With. I Thought You Were Gonna Say Nuts. ---Mahir

textcards.caption: BISHOP-KNIGHT SWAP
textcards.description: Bishops take like Knights. Knights take backward like Bishops. Both move normally.
textcards.quote: Quote needed

textcards.caption: NIGHT KING QUEEN
textcards.description: Queens move and take like Knight+King.
textcards.quote: Night's King was only a man by light of day, Old Nan would always say, but the night was his to rule. ---Brandon Stark

textcards.caption: ARCHBISHOP
textcards.description: Queens move and take like Bishop+Knight. Fairy chess Archbishop.
textcards.quote: If people want a sense of purpose they should get it from their archbishop. They should certainly not get it from their politicians. ---Harold MacMillan

textcards.caption: CHANCELLOR
textcards.description: Queens move and take like Rook+Knight. Fairy chess Chancellor.
textcards.quote: When I'm stirring a saucepan, I don't say to myself, 'Now the chancellor is stirring a saucepan'. ---Angela Merkel

textcards.caption: CROWNED BISHOP
textcards.description: Bishops may also move/take live a King.
textcards.quote: In the land of the blind the one-eyed man is king. ---Efren Ramirez

textcards.caption: CROWNED CASTLE
textcards.description: Rooks may also move/take live a King.
textcards.quote: In the land of the skunks, he who has half a nose is king. ---Chris Farley

textcards.caption: BLOCKADE
textcards.description: At the end of a Rook move, it may be inverted. Upside-down rooks cannot be taken or attack. Draw another card.
textcards.quote: Everyone thinks at some point if what they are doing has any meaning or not. ---William Macbeth

textcards.caption: CHINESE CANNON
textcards.description: A rook takes by throwing a friendly piece so that it jumps the rook in a rook direction.
textcards.quote: I spend most of my life feeling like I've been shot out of a cannon. ---Molly Ivins

textcards.caption: SIEGE TOWER
textcards.description: A piece may move legally to where there is a rook. It goes on top making a combined piece. The combination acts as the bottom rook. The piece on top can move off as a normal action. Stacks are ok. Multi-color is ok.

textcards.caption: IMMOBILIZER
textcards.description: Pieces adjacent to an enemy Rook may not move. Rooks may not capture. Ultima Chess.
textcards.quote: The activity of worrying keeps you immobilized. ---Wayne Dyer

textcards.caption: ROYAL REVERSE
textcards.description: Bishops and Rooks may move and take backwards like a Queen.
textcards.quote: To the royal guards of this realm, we are all victims in-waiting. ---Cheshire Cat

textcards.caption: ROOK-QUEEN SWAP
textcards.description: Queens and Rooks move normally, but take like each other.
textcards.quote: I am definitely the queen. I definitely see myself as the queen. ---Lil' Kim

textcards.caption: KNIGHT-KING SWAP
textcards.description: Knights and Kings move/take like each other.
textcards.quote: If I was King for just one day, I would give it all away. --Thompson Twins

textcards.caption: KING CHAMELEON
textcards.description: Kings may also move/take like any piece attacking them.
textcards.quote: I can kind of be a chameleon. ---Sasha Spielberg

textcards.caption: SUMMONER
textcards.description: Bishops may summon a friendly non-King piece to an adjacent square
textcards.quote: My name is Mortimer Alexander and I am a licensed summoner." "Darn. I'd hoped you were the pizza delivery guy. ---Jana Oliver

textcards.caption: BISHOP CHAMPION
textcards.description: Bishops may move/take using a 2 square jump in any direction. They may also move/take one square rectilinearly.
textcards.quote: Every absurdity has a champion to defend it. ---Oliver Goldsmith

textcards.caption: RETREATER
textcards.description: Bishops move like a queen, but take by moving away from an adjacent piece.
textcards.quote: He who fights and runs away, lives to fight another day. ---Proverb

textcards.caption: BANISHER
textcards.description: Bishops only move like Queens and banish an adjacent non-King enemy piece to any empty square.
textcards.quote: I know that you cannot banish the truth permanently, you can only cloud it temporarily. ---Javed Jaffrey

textcards.caption: BISHOP CHAMELEON
textcards.description: Bishops move normally, but only attack pieces that attack them. Bishops attack each other normally. Ultima Chess.
textcards.quote: I could spend the rest of my life in copying a chair. ---Alberto Giacometti

textcards.caption: BISHOP LONG LEAPER
textcards.description: Bishops move like a queen, but take by leaping over a piece. Ultima Chess.
textcards.quote: That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind. ---Neil Armstrong

textcards.caption: CLERICAL CLONES
textcards.description: Bishops may move/take like the last piece the opponent moved.
textcards.quote: I'm starting to see players copy what I do. I'm flattered. ---Dennis Rodman

textcards.caption: GOLD GENERAL
